{"id":540398435,"lang":"cpp","time":"8Â months","timestamp":1629290355,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"40 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/540398435/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"89.3 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int kth(vector<int>& a, vector<int>& b, int la, int ra, int lb, int rb, int k) {\n        int alen = ra - la + 1;    \n        int blen = rb - lb + 1;\n        \n        if (alen <= 0) {\n            return b[lb+k-1];    \n        }\n        if (blen <= 0) {\n            return a[la+k-1];\n        }\n        if (k == 1) {\n            return min(a[la], b[lb]);\n        }\n        \n        int astep = min(k/2, alen);\n        int bstep = min(k/2, blen);\n        \n        if (a[la + astep - 1] <= b[lb + bstep - 1]) {\n            return kth(a, b, la + astep, ra, lb, rb, k-astep);\n        }\n        return kth(b, a, lb, rb, la, ra, k);\n    }\n    \n    double findMedianSortedArrays(vector<int>& nums1, vector<int>& nums2) {\n        int alen = nums1.size(); int blen = nums2.size();\n        int len = nums1.size() + nums2.size();\n        double m1 = kth(nums1, nums2, 0, alen-1, 0, blen-1, len/2 + 1);\n        \n        // cout << len/2 << ' ' << len/2 + 1 << endl;\n        if (len % 2 == 0) {\n            double m2 = kth(nums1, nums2, 0, alen-1, 0, blen-1, len/2);\n            // cout << m1 << ' ' << m2 << endl;\n            return (m2 + m1)/2.0;\n        }\n        return m1;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays"}
